intro: Villebrunea pilosula, commonly known as the hairy villebrunea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Villebrunea pilosula is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
